title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: No children node listing appears when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: Children nodes should be listed when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab. All relevant database/table/column information should be displayed.
SR: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Description: No children node listing appears when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor data source page, change the data source. 3. The new data source has no database/table/column information. Actual result: No children node listing appears when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
